cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi SE of Great Abaco Island
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across the north-western Bahamas, skirt or make landfall along the east-central Florida coast Saturday, then cross the Florida Peninsula and curve north-northeast toward Georgia and the Carolinas early next week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warning only for the north-western Bahamas (Abacos, Berry Islands, Bimini, Eleuthera, Grand Bahama, New Providence)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East coast of Florida, Georgia coast (including Port of Brunswick), and portions of South Carolina/North Carolina within 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (39–57 mph) possible late Sunday into Monday as the system moves inland across Georgia.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast at this time.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain, generally 2–4 inches, could cause localized ponding and brief port-area drainage issues.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls and reduced visibility may intermittently interrupt cargo and vessel operations.
